effect.description: Decreased liking for rebels compared to obedient confederates (in non-self-affirmed control condition) eliminated in self-affirmed condition
orig.article.title: The rejection of moral rebels: Resenting those who do the right thing.

effect.description: Positive relation between indirect ratings (AMP) and direct ratings (of Black vs. White faces) stronger in low (compared to high) pressure to respond in socially desirable manner conditions.
orig.article.title: Why do implicit and explicit attitude tests diverge? The role of structural fit.

effect.description: Younger respondents show greater variability (variance) in acquiescent response tendencies than older respondents.
design: Levene's test for equality of variance
orig.article.title: The developmental psychometrics of big five self-reports: Acquiescence, factor structure, coherence, and differentiation from ages 10 to 20.

effect.description: Increased relative preference for parent among mortality-salience induced Ps scoring low on avoidance but high on anxiety compared to control conditions (dental pain)
orig.article.title: Terror management and adults' attachment to their parents: The safe haven remains.

effect.description: Ps primed with action words correctly solved higher number of SAT-type verbal and math problems than Ps primed with inaction words.
orig.article.title: Increasing and decreasing motor and cognitive output: A model of general action and inaction goals.

target.effect: action priming boosts # of thoughts effect
rep.method.differences: German instead of English language
effect.description: Action-word primed Ps completing an inactive task generated a greater number of thoughts compared to inaction-primed Ps completing an active task, with no difference in thoughts in control conditions.
orig.article.title: Increasing and decreasing motor and cognitive output: A model of general action and inaction goals.

effect.description: Affective coherence increased cognitive complexity in participant-generated narratives compared to affective incoherence.
orig.article.title: Affective incoherence: When affective concepts and embodied reactions clash.

effect.description: Low-prejudice Ps whose non-prejudiced responses were motivated by internal (but not external) factors exhibited better control on a stereotype-inhibition task than did Ps motivated by a combination of internal and external factors.
orig.article.title: Individual differences in the regulation of intergroup bias: The role of conflict monitoring and neural signals for control.

effect.description: Action-oriented mindset caused attitude changes from pre- to post-decision to both chosen and rejected alternatives, whereas positive-nonaction and neutral mindsets caused attitude changes solely to rejected alternative.
orig.article.title: Left frontal cortical activation and spreading of alternatives: Tests of the action-based model of dissonance.

orig.study.number: van Dijk, van Kleef et al. (2008) Study 3
effect.description: Ps made lower bargaining offers to angry (compared to happy) recipients than happy, but only when consequences of rejection were low.
orig.article.title: A social functional approach to emotions in bargaining: when communicating anger pays and when it backfires.

effect.description: Ps believed confederate's expressions were happier than their private feelings, but only in vulnerable conditions.
orig.article.title: Walking on eggshells: How expressing relationship insecurities perpetuates them.

effect.description: Ps own responsiveness was a significant predictor of their perception of their partners' responsiveness.
orig.article.title: How the head liberates the heart: Projection of communal responsiveness guides relationship promotion.

effect.description: Ps (college seniors) reminded they were experiencing their last day as students at graduation reported fewer mixed emotions than Ps not reminded.
orig.article.title: Poignancy: Mixed emotional experience in the face of meaningful endings.

target.effect: modulation of 1/f noise racial bias emission effect
IVs: avoid/use race information vs. control instructions
rep.method.differences: Canadian rather than US undergraduates; keyboard used instead of response box;
rep.active.sample.evidence: Racial bias (in terms of RT) higher in use and avoid race (compared to control) conditions (d = .34 ± .35); 1/f noise observed within each of the 3 conditions (p<.0001)
effect.description: Ps in use-race or avoid-race instruction conditions exhibited less 1/f noise (as reflected in PSD slopes) on WIT than Ps in a control condition.
design: between ANOVA using planned orthogonal contrasts
orig.article.title: 1/f noise and effort on implicit measures of bias.

effect.description: Aggression priming increased perceptions of aggression (assimilation effect) among Ps whose processing style induced to be global (or control) whereas it decreased perceptions of aggression (contrast effect) among Ps whose processing style induced to be local.
orig.article.title: The effect of global versus local processing styles on assimilation versus contrast in social judgment.

effect.description: Subtly asking Ps questions about their empathic understanding and capability of exhibiting similar transgressions reduced male (but not female) Ps' feelings of vengefulness.
orig.article.title: Not so innocent: Does seeing one's own capacity for wrongdoing predict forgiveness?

effect.description: Tempting fate effect (tempting fate increases perceived likelihood of negative outcomes) amplified under cognitive load compared to a control condition.
orig.article.title: Why people are reluctant to tempt fate.

effect.description: Ps recognized conveyed emotions as pride at an above chance level, no matter what culture target represented.
orig.article.title: The nonverbal expression of pride: Evidence for cross-cultural recognition.

target.effect: Wason task performance and cognitive ability correlation
effect.description: Ps correctly answering Wason's four-card selection task exhibited higher cognitive ability (SAT scores) than Ps answering card task incorrectly.
orig.article.title: On the relative independence of thinking biases and cognitive ability.

effect.description: Strong arguments more persuasive than weak arguments among Ps forced to focus on important values in the messages, but no argument strength effect among Ps forced to focus on unimportant values.
orig.article.title: Opening the mind to close it: Considering a message in light of important values increases message processing and later resistance to change.

effect.description: Bumper stickers of descriptive deviants rated as more popular than bumper stickers of prescriptive deviants.
orig.article.title: Distinguishing between silent and vocal minorities: Not all deviants feel marginal.

effect.description: Increased donations to HIV/AIDS initiative when emphasizing "to-date" information among Ps who hadn't yet donated, but emphasizing "to-go" information among Ps who had.
orig.article.title: Dynamics of self-regulation: How (un) accomplished goal actions affect motivation.

orig.study.number: Henderson, de Liver et al. (2008) Study 5
effect.description: Ps in one-sided focus condition exhibited less ambivalence than participants in two-sided focus condition.
orig.article.title: The effects of an implemental mind-set on attitude strength.

effect.description: Ps in perpetrator condition reported higher need for social acceptance and reconciliation after moral acceptance was restored, whereas Ps in victim condition reported higher need for power and reconciliation after sense of power was restored.
orig.article.title: A needs-based model of reconciliation: Satisfying the differential emotional needs of victim and perpetrator as a key to promoting reconciliation.

effect.description: Composite ratings of perceived power and leadership positively correlated with company profits, even after controlling for CEO age, CEO attractiveness, and affect CEOs displayed in photo.
orig.article.title: The face of success: inferences from chief executive officers' appearance predict company profits.

effect.description: Decision-makers prefer inconsistent information when choosing between two pieces of information, but prefer consistent information when choosing between more pieces of information.
orig.article.title: Selective exposure and information quantity: How different information quantities moderate decision makers' preference for consistent and inconsistent information.

effect.description: Ps whose self-regulation resources depleted exhibited increased biases in confirmatory information processing compared to non-depleted and ego-threatened condition Ps
orig.article.title: Self-regulation and selective exposure: The impact of depleted self-regulation resources on confirmatory information processing.

effect.description: When learning goals absent, Ps sat closer to each other when they discussed love and relationships compared to when they discussed racial profiling.
orig.article.title: The space between us: Stereotype threat and distance in interracial contexts.

target.effect: generalized earning prospect predicts romantic interest effect
effect.description: Perceived earning prospects significantly positively predicted romantic interest in speed-dating situation for both men and women (absence of evidence for interaction effect).
design: Meta-analytic summary of interaction effects in 14 multilevel models
orig.article.title: Sex differences in mate preferences revisited: Do people know what they initially desire in a romantic partner?

effect.description: When primed with approach goals, low self-esteem Ps in partner criticism condition believed their partner regarded them significantly more negatively than did controls.
orig.article.title: Balancing connectedness and self-protection goals in close relationships: A levels-of-processing perspective on risk regulation.

effect.description: Self-handicap condition Ps performed worse on mathematical questions task than control condition Ps.
orig.article.title: Self-handicapping, excuse making, and counterfactual thinking: Consequences for self-esteem and future motivation.

effect.description: Among Black, but not White professionals, high (compared to low) fairness cue lowered expectations of threatening identity contingencies and increased trust.
orig.article.title: social identity contingencies: How diversity cues signal threat or safety for African Americans in mainstream institutions.

target.effect: fluency priming on psychological distance effect
effect.description: Conceptually-fluent primed Ps reported increased preference for concrete descriptions of the prime later, compared to conceptually-disfluent primed Ps.
orig.article.title: Effects of fluency on psychological distance and mental construal (or why New York is a large city, but New York is a civilized jungle).

effect.description: Goal primed Ps learned more on an incidental-learning task (serial reaction time task; SRT) than control-group Ps.
orig.article.title: Nonconscious goal pursuit in novel environments: The case of implicit learning.

target.effect: sex difference in perceived sexual interest effect
effect.description: Male Ps exhibited less sensitivity in distinguishing friendliness versus sexual interest compared to women (supporting a male perceptual insensitivity account).
orig.article.title: Perceptual mechanisms that characterize gender differences in decoding women's sexual intent

effect.description: Among accurate, optimistic, or pessimistic predictions, Ps most likely to recommend optimistic predictions.
orig.article.title: Prescribed optimism: Is it right to be wrong about the future?

effect.description: Older adults produced fewer internal details, but more external details compared to young adults.
orig.article.title: Age-related changes in the episodic simulation of future events

effect.description: Ps in depletion/placebo group exhibited larger attraction effect compared to Ps in other three conditions (depletion with sugar, no depletion with sugar, no depletion with placebo).
orig.article.title: Toward a physiology of dual-process reasoning and judgment: lemonade, willpower, and expensive rule-based analysis.

effect.description: Startle response magnitude following an error negatively correlated to Error-Related Negativity (ERN) amplitude.
orig.article.title: Errors Are Aversive: Defensive Motivation and the Error-Related Negativity

effect.description: Accepting unfair offers increased activation in right ventrolateral prefrontal cortex compared to baseline
orig.article.title: The sunny side of fairness: Preference for fairness activates reward circuitry (and disregarding unfairness activates self-control circuitry)

target.effect: loving woman who justify inequality effect
effect.description: Male Ps whose faith in economic system was threatened reported greater romantic interest in women who embody (versus did not embody) benevolent sexist ideals
orig.article.title: Loving those who justify inequality: the effects of system threat on attraction to women who embody benevolent sexist ideals.

target.effect: threat of appearing prejudiced attentional bias effect
effect.description: Ps with high "external motivation" (EM) to be non-prejudiced exhibited attentional biases for neutral, but not happy Black faces.
orig.article.title: The threat of appearing prejudiced and race-based attentional biases.

effect.description: When White man made potentially offensive comment in presence of Black man, Ps who could hear interaction looked at Black man for a longer compared to when Ps couldnt hear interaction.
orig.article.title: Where do we look during potentially offensive behavior?

target.effect: having what you want happiness effect
effect.description: People who had what they wanted were happier than others, even after controlling for the degree to which they wanted what they had.
orig.article.title: Is happiness having what you want, wanting what you have, or both?

target.effect: implicit attitude generalization occurs immediately effect
effect.description: Information about original individuals automatically influenced Ps' implicit responses toward new individuals from same social category.
orig.article.title: Implicit attitude generalization occurs immediately; explicit attitude generalization takes time

effect.description: Ps who read anti-free-will essay cheated more often that Ps who read a control essay.
orig.article.title: The value of believing in free will: Encouraging a belief in determinism increases cheating.

target.effect: distance priming boosts psychological closeness effect
effect.description: Distance-primed Ps reported higher levels of closeness toward one's family members and hometown compared to control condition Ps.
orig.article.title: Keeping one's distance: The influence of spatial distance cues on affect and evaluation.

effect.description: When Ps anticipated playing confrontational games, Ps preferred anger-inducing activities more so than exciting and neutral activities.
orig.article.title: Hedonic and instrumental motives in anger regulation.

target.effect: social disconnection boosts supernatural agent beliefs effect
effect.description: socially disconnected condition Ps reported stronger beliefs in supernatural agents and events (and attributed more social traits to pets) compared to control condition Ps.
orig.article.title: Creating social connection through inferential reproduction: Loneliness and perceived agency in gadgets, gods, and greyhounds.

effect.description: Ps in an intergroup prisoners dilemma-maximizing difference (IPD-MD) game contributed fewer tokens than Ps in an intergroup prisoners dilemma (IPD) game.
orig.article.title: ÏIn_Group Love? and ÏOut_Group Hate? as Motives for Individual Participation in Intergroup Conflict: A New Game Paradigm

target.effect: ovulation boosts attraction to single men effect
effect.description: Attached women are more attracted to single men when they're ovulating (compared to not ovulating), but are more attracted to attached men when they're not ovulating (compared to ovulating).
orig.article.title: The Best Men Are (Not Always) Already Taken: Female Preference for Single Versus Attached Males Depends on Conception Risk

target.effect: ovulation boosts attraction to single men effect
effect.description: Attached women are more attracted to single men when they're ovulating (compared to not ovulating), but are more attracted to attached men when they're not ovulating (compared to ovulating).
orig.article.title: The Best Men Are (Not Always) Already Taken: Female Preference for Single Versus Attached Males Depends on Conception Risk

rep.method.differences: US rather than UK undergraduates
rep.active.sample.evidence: a = .62 on private body consciousness (PBC) subscale
effect.description: After experiencing disgust, Ps who washed their hands judged questionable behaviors as less morally wrong than Ps who did not wash their hands.
orig.article.title: With a clean conscience: Cleanliness reduces the severity of moral judgments.

effect.description: Perceptions of National Characters (PNC) measure negatively correlated with behavioural and demographic measures of conscientiousness (validity criteria).
orig.article.title: What Do Cross_National Comparisons of Personality Traits Tell Us? The Case of Conscientiousness

effect.description: Ps scoring high in dominance exhibited faster RTs to vertical compare to horizontal stimuli, unlike Ps scoring low in dominance
orig.article.title: Personality dominance and preferential use of the vertical dimension of space

effect.description: Interaction between Perspective Memory (PM) cue dimension and compatibility on mean proportion of errors (missed PM cues).
orig.article.title: Conflict-triggered goal shielding: Response conflicts attenuate background monitoring for prospective memory cues.

effect.description: Ps underestimated number of pictures belonging to category for which they expected to be paid compared to control pictures in non-endowed category.
orig.article.title: The value heuristic in judgments of relative frequency.

effect.description: Effect of relation between target and distractor was present for picture naming, but absent for word reading.
orig.article.title: Tracing attention and the activation flow in spoken word planning using eye movements.

effect.description: Repetition blindness (RB) effect observed for nonwords.
orig.article.title: Now you see it, now you don't: repetition blindness for nonwords

target.effect: working memory task switching costs effect
effect.description: Lower recall for low-switch lists with degraded stimuli compared to low-switch lists with normal (non-degraded) stimuli.
orig.article.title: Working memory costs of task switching.

effect.description: Larger relearning effect for non-practiced items from practiced categories than non-practiced items from non-practiced categories.
orig.article.title: Accelerated relearning after retrieval-induced forgetting: The benefit of being forgotten.

effect.description: Intermixedblocked effect: Intermixed pre-exposure to stimuli lead to better  performance (perceptual learning) compared to non-intermixed pre-exposure.
orig.article.title: The intermixed-blocked effect in human perceptual learning is not the consequence of trial spacing.

target.effect: independent memory sources for priming & recognition effect
effect.description: Faster RTs to misses compared to correct rejections (suggesting memory sources for priming and recognition are independent).
orig.article.title: A single-system account of the relationship between priming, recognition, and fluency.

target.effect: enhanced memory for word order effect
effect.description: Enhanced memory for order of words when word lists contained only short words compared to when word lists only contained long words.
orig.article.title: Modeling distributions of immediate memory effects: No strategies needed?

effect.description: Higher number of incorrect judgments observed for schema-consistent attributions in neutral proportion condition and schema-inconsistent attributions in conflicting proportion condition.
orig.article.title: Stereotypes and retrieval-provoked illusory source recollections.

effect.description: Comparative distance effect observed when task required numerical matching.
orig.article.title: Across-notation automatic numerical processing.

effect.description: Words with many near neighbors (e.g., chicken) associated with increased level of processing (i.e., categorized more slowly) compared to words with few near neighbors (e.g., hyena)
orig.article.title: Attractor dynamics and semantic neighborhood density: Processing is slowed by near neighbors and speeded by distant neighbors.

effect.description: Pronounced disruptive effect of between-sequence phonological similarity on free recall of lists of end rhyming words.
orig.article.title: When does between-sequence phonological similarity promote irrelevant sound disruption?

effect.description: RTs faster when participants were given the same mathematical operation to practice and to test, relative to operational change or a new problem.
orig.article.title: Bidirectional associations in multiplication memory: Conditions of negative and positive transfer.

effect.description: Higher number of errors on low contingency trials compared to medium contingency trials.
orig.article.title: The Stroop effect: Why proportion congruent has nothing to do with congruency and everything to do with contingency.

effect.description: Tendency to underestimate (overestimate) frequency of positive (negative) observations increased from provider with smallest to provider with highest overall frequency.
orig.article.title: The ultimate sampling dilemma in experience-based decision making.

effect.description: Higher new probe accuracy for short compared to long lists.
orig.article.title: How to say no: Single-and dual-process theories of short-term recognition tested on negative probes.

effect.description: Directed forgetting effect observed for spaced but not grouped (massed) items.
orig.article.title: Intentional forgetting is easier after two "shots" than one.

effect.description: Bilingual Ps less successful than monolinguals at reporting T2 target when it lagged a successfully identified T1 target by 2 items (i.e., at lag 3).
orig.article.title: How does bilingualism improve executive control? A comparison of active and reactive inhibition mechanisms.

effect.description: RT difference between sum and neutral targets larger when cue digits primed with categorical (compared to unrelated or functionally related) primes.
orig.article.title: Priming addition facts with semantic relations.

effect.description: Likelihood of producing a given response increased as a function of the number of times same response had previously been recalled, even for errors.
orig.article.title: Learning correct responses and errors in the Hebb repetition effect: two faces of the same coin.

effect.description: No delay in response when switching between pronouncing regular words and nonwords.
orig.article.title: Contextual effects on reading aloud: Evidence for pathway control.

effect.description: Larger frequency effect for degraded compared to non-degraded words (interaction between stimulus quality and word frequency).
orig.article.title: On the additive effects of stimulus quality and word frequency in lexical decision: Evidence for opposing interactive influences revealed by RT distributional analyses.

target.effect: semantic interference in naming task revisited
effect.description: RTs slower for semantically-related compared to semantically unrelated word-picture pairs in a delayed picture naming task.
orig.article.title: Semantic interference in a delayed naming task: Evidence for the response exclusion hypothesis.

effect.description: Above-chance recall rate on real-triplet test trials compared to familiarization phase (can visual statistical learning be feature-based over colors of objects?).
orig.article.title: Multidimensional visual statistical learning.

target.effect: contingency information in causal judgments effect
effect.description: A+ instances raised judgment of A and lowered judgment of B as causes for outcome.
orig.article.title: Accounting for occurrences: A new view of the use of contingency information in causal judgment.

effect.description: Ps instructed to group items induced temporal gap between groups, both when trying to recall order of items and when trying to recall timing of items.
orig.article.title: Multiple roles for time in short-term memory: Evidence from serial recall of order and timing.

effect.description: Number of correct responses differed only as a function of the type of dependency.
orig.article.title: An attention-based associative account of adjacent and nonadjacent dependency learning.

target.effect: visual working memory orienting attention effect
effect.description: For both shape and color conditions, better recall for retro(active) compared to simultaneous cue at all set sizes (except set size = 1).
orig.article.title: Orienting attention in visual working memory reduces interference from memory probes.

target.effect: learning on risky decision making effect
effect.description: Comparison of correlations between ART and drug use in sunny versus cloudy conditions.
design: Test of contrast of 4 correlated correlations.
orig.article.title: Decision making and learning while taking sequential risks.

effect.description: Directional language (e.g., "to the left") helps children bind color and shape information to a greater extent than relational language alone (e.g., "next to").
orig.article.title: More than meets the eye: the role of language in binding and maintaining feature conjunctions.

effect.description: More precise (e.g., $9.99) compared to less price (e.g., $10) anchors decreased (anchoring effect) adjustment.
orig.article.title: Precision of the anchor influences the amount of adjustment.

effect.description: Sample entropy was higher for middle-truth-value questions than for low- and high-truth-value questions.
orig.article.title: Action dynamics reveal parallel competition in decision making

target.effect: perspective taking in word learning effect
effect.description: Older children selected correct object more frequently than would be expected by chance on "where" trials.
orig.article.title: Preschoolers' perspective taking in word learning: do they blindly follow eye gaze?

effect.description: Averaging two guesses within one person provides a more accurate answer than either guess alone.
orig.article.title: Measuring the crowd within: Probabilistic representations within individuals.

target.effect: temporal selection in attentional blink effect
effect.description: Selection is (a) suppressed (efficacy), (b) delayed (latency), and (c) diffused (precision) in time during the attentional blink.
orig.article.title: Temporal selection is suppressed, delayed, and diffused during the attentional blink.

target.effect: representation of ensemble visual features effect
effect.description: Fewer localization errors for targets compared to distractors in the centroid condition.
orig.article.title: The representation of simple ensemble visual features outside the focus of attention

effect.description: Motion aftereffects were present following the presentation of a still photograph depicting motion
orig.article.title: A motion aftereffect from still photographs depicting motion

effect.description: Higher recall for words rated for survival relevance compared to control words.
orig.article.title: Adaptive memory: The comparative value of survival processing.

effect.description: Auditory memory makes change detection easier in audition than in vision.
orig.article.title: Auditory change detection: simple sounds are not memorized better than complex sounds

effect.description: Color and object naming times in congruent condition faster than in incongruent condition in color and object naming tasks, respectively.
orig.article.title: A word-order constraint on phonological activation

effect.description: Significant interaction between viewpoint (prototypical or non-prototypical) and visual field (upper visual field or lower visual field) on the probability of the first fixation being on the target.
orig.article.title: Sensitivity to object viewpoint and action instructions during search for targets in the lower visual field

effect.description: Surfaces with a single EE (EE1) along the shared contour were perceived as closer than surfaces with two EE's orthogonal to the shared contour (Convex2)
orig.article.title: Extremal edge: a powerful cue to depth perception and figure-ground organization

target.effect: snake in the grass detection effect
effect.description: Faster identification RTs for fear-relevant compared to fear-irrelevant stimuli, in both children and adults.
orig.article.title: Detecting the snake in the grass: attention to fear-relevant stimuli by adults and young children.

effect.description: Attentional effect of object words interfered with the visual perception of a target in the typical location of the object.
orig.article.title: Head up, foot down: Object words orient attention to the objects' typical location.

DVs: love (4 items); commitment to marrige (1 item)

effect.description: Increases in parental interference positively associated with increases in love over time

target.effect: commitment priming boosts forgiveness effect (exit forgiveness DV)
IVs: high vs. low commitment priming (dependence vs. independence from partner)
rep.method.differences: DV assessed via computer rather than paper-and-pencil
rep.active.sample.evidence: a = .90 on subjective commitment measure
other.outcomes: 3 other DVs (neglect, voice, loyalty forgiveness; same pattern of results observed)
ES.description: MD = mean difference between high vs. low commitment priming on exit forgiveness (negative value means lower levels of exit forgiveness)
effect.description: High commitment priming (writing about interdependence to partner) increases forgiveness on hypothetical betrayals compared to low commitment priming (writing about independence)
